info.name: Oblex
info.description: The Oblex race from The Archivist's Guide to the Khyan Continent.
info.author: Oroka_

element.name: Oblex
element.source: The Archivist's Guide to the Khyan Continent

description.p: Oblex are creatures created by mindflayers that feed upon memories. (This is an adaptation of a hombrew on DnDBeyond made by Jester_BE with tweaks made by Oroka_).

The first oblexes were created by the Illithid, otherwise known as the Mindflayers long ago. Horrid experiments which manifested from slimes that existed in the Underdark, these creatures harbour a constant need for absorbing the memories of other intelligent creatures. This need makes their kind hated among the denizens of the Underdark, and if any upon the surface know of them, they likely despise them as well.

The mutated spawn of an oblex is unwanted, and usually killed when an adult or elder oblex learns of what their spawn may be. They view these creatures as lesser, undeserving of life, something that should not be while all the while unaware the creature itself is the same. Oblexes who do survive tend to isolate themselves and mimic the form of their most dominant memory, or hide amongst the populace of the Underdark.
description.h4: HANGING ON A CLIFF FOR SURVIVAL
description.p: The Oblexes that do survive in a settlement or make their way to the surface must create a careful balance between their needs and the of risk being discovered. Oblexes do not feed as other races do. Instead, they survive on thoughts to maintain their form and intelligence. They can eat and consume food and liquids, but they don’t have a need for it as the memories they absorb are their true form of sustenance. Their dominant personality is constantly warring with itself, either with other minds that slipped into its form or the constant rambling from the different thoughts.

What little society exists of Oblexes is limited in its capabilities, as the constant need for new memories to survive and to remain hidden outweighs conversing with others of its kind. However, Oblexes do have a better chance of detecting others of their kind, but they rarely converse . Surprisingly enough, Oblexes are capable of reproducing by combining loose memories they’ve gathered with the loose memories of another Oblex.
Your Oblex character has the following traits.
Ability Score Increase You get a +2 to your intelligence score and can have a +1 bonus to either wisdom or constitution.

Age. Oblex age differently from most species. Most succumb to the madness of the many minds they host before even achieving a glimpse at old age. Most oblex can last a couple of centuries before being eveloped by insanity. From being a spawn, oblex mature quickly into adulthood, dependent upon the availability of food.
Alignment. Oblexes are typically inclined towards an evil alignment but truly lean more neutral.
Size. An Oblex's size is ever changing and can be either small or medium but cannot exceed medium for extended periods of time.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Sulfurous Impersonation. As an action, you can transform your appearance or revert to your natural form. You can’t duplicate the appearance of a creature you’ve never seen, and you revert to your natural form if you die. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, the sound of your voice, coloration, hair length, sex, and any other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You also can’t appear as a creature of a larger size than you. Your clothing and other equipment don’t change in appearance, size, or shape to match your new form, requiring you to keep a few extra outfits on hand to make the most compelling disguise possible. Even to the most astute observers, your ruse is usually indiscernible. If you rouse suspicion, or if a wary creature suspects something is amiss, you have advantage on any Charisma (Deception) check you make to avoid detection. While using this ability, you smell faintly of sulfur.

Innate Psionic Abilities. Like all Oblex, you have innate psionic abilities. You can read the surface thoughts, similar to the detect thoughts spell, when interacting with another creature for longer than one minute. At level 3, you can cast detect thoughts spell once per short or long rest. At level 8, you can feed using your detect thoughts, but this only works when the target is within 30 ft. Additionally at level 8, you can cast hold person once per long rest.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Deep Speech, as well as the native language of the race you are currently impersonating.

Need to Feed. An Oblex craves information; they need it to survive. This can take many forms, be it a novel, encyclopedia, or someone's memories. Memories will sustain an oblex most efficiently, however, an oblex can obtain a days worth of food from about an hours worth of reading. Memories will sustain an oblex for 5 days an allow it to grow, whilst book knowledge will only sustain it. To feed on memories the oblex places a part of their form on another creature and over the course of 1d4 x the creature's Intelligence modifier minutes you siphon out informations. You gain their form an whilst in that form you can speak any languages they speak.

Creature of the Deep. Due to your fragmented mind, you are vulnerable to psychic damage. Furthermore, if you take fire damage, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
